From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From re- +‎ passer.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ʁə.pa.se/ ~ /ʁə.pɑ.se/
  • Audio:(file)
  • Audio (France (Vosges)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Vosges)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Lyon)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Somain)):(file)

Verb

[edit]

repasser

  1. to iron (to pass an iron over clothing)
  2. to pass by again
  3. to redo (an exam, a test)

Usage notes

[edit]
  • This verb uses the auxiliary verb avoir when used transitively (or with a transitive sense, even when the complement is omitted); otherwise (when it is intransitive), it uses être.
  • il a repassé sa chemise
    he ironed his shirt
  • je suis repassé par la poste ce matin
    I went by the post office again this morning

1 The French gerund is usable only with the preposition en.
2 In less formal writing or speech, these tenses may be found to have been replaced in the following way:
past historic → present perfect
past anterior → pluperfect
imperfect subjunctive → present subjunctive
pluperfect subjunctive → past subjunctive

(Christopher Kendris [1995], Master the Basics: French, pp. 77, 78, 79, 81).

Derived terms

[edit]
  • fer à repasser
  • planche à repasser
  • table à repasser

Further reading

[edit]
  • “repasser”, in Trésor de la langue française informatisé [Digitized Treasury of the French Language], 2012.

Anagrams

[edit]
  • pressera

Old French

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

repasser

  1. to retraverse (to traverse again)

Conjugation

[edit]

This verb conjugates as a first-group verb ending in -er. The forms that would normally end in *-ss, *-sss, *-sst are modified to s, s, st. Old French conjugation varies significantly by date and by region. The following conjugation should be treated as a guide.

    Conjugation of repasser (see also Appendix:Old French verbs)
simple compound
infinitive repasser avoir repassé
gerund en repassant gerund of avoir + past participle
present participle repassant
past participle repassé
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu il nos vos il
simple
tenses 		present repas repasses repasse repassons repassez repassent
imperfect repassoie, repasseie, repassoe, repasseve repassoies, repasseies, repassoes, repasseves repassoit, repasseit, repassot, repasseve repassiiens, repassiens repassiiez, repassiez repassoient, repasseient, repassoent, repassevent
preterite repassai repassas repassa repassames repassastes repasserent
future repasserai repasseras repassera repasserons repasseroiz, repassereiz, repasserez repasseront
conditional repasseroie, repassereie repasseroies, repassereies repasseroit, repassereit repasseriiens, repasseriens repasseriiez, repasseriez repasseroient, repassereient
compound
tenses 		present perfect present tense of avoir + past participle
pluperfect imperfect tense of avoir + past participle
